verses.roman:
sei abhimāna-sukhe āpanā pāsare
'kṛṣṇa-dāsa' hao--jīve upadeśa kare

synonyms: sei—that; abhimāna-sukhe—in the happiness of that conception; āpanā—Himself; pāsare—He forgets; kṛṣṇa-dāsa hao—You are servants of Lord Kṛṣṇa; jīve—the living beings; upadeśa kare—He instructs.
translation: He forgets Himself in the joy of that conception and teaches all living entities, "You are servants of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu."

purport.content: The transcendental devotional service of the Supreme Personality of Godhead is so ecstatic that even the Lord Himself plays the part of a devotee. Forgetting Himself to be the Supreme, He personally teaches the whole world how to render service to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
